text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Model 2 is a video game system intended for arcades, marketed by Sega in 1993. The Model 2 is an evolution of the architecture of the Model 1 system. It was developed in collaboration with Martin Marietta. The system went through four revisions: the Model 21, Model 2A CRX2, Model 2B CRX3, Model 2C CRX4. All systems incorporate an Intel i960 central processor. The Model 2 uses the sound card of the Model 1. The Model 2 became very popular with video games like Daytona USA and the first installment of the famous The House of the Dead series.
